data.question: What is the critical temperature of the metal-organic ferrimagnets reported?
What elements are key components in data processing and storage devices?
What is the room-temperature coercivity of the resulting metal-organic ferrimagnets?
What strategy is promising for the design of next-generation magnets?
data.answer: Versatile coordination chemistry of abundant metal ions and inexpensive organic ligands

data.question: What is the role of radicals in raising the operating temperature of molecule-based magnets?
data.answer: The presence of a radical's spin leads to particularly strong magnetic interactions with the metal centers

data.question: What is the maximum critical temperature measured for a molecule-based magnet before this work?
True or False: The exclusively inorganic magnets do not suffer from any drawbacks.
True or False: The molecule-based materials feature remarkably high densities compared to inorganic materials.
True or False: The postsynthetic chemical reduction of CrCl2(pyz)2 results in a mixture of insoluble crystalline Li[SO3CH3] and an amorphous CrII(pyz(cid:129)−)2 phase.
What is the critical temperature of Li0.7[Cr(pyz)2]Cl0.7·0.25(THF)?
What is the room-temperature coercivity of Li0.7[Cr(pyz)2]Cl0.7·0.25(THF)?
What is the main advantage of molecule-based magnets over traditional inorganic magnets?
data.answer: Molecule-based magnets benefit from the synthetic and postsynthetic versatility allowing precise tailoring and optimization of their properties

data.question: True or False: The molecule-based materials reported have operating temperatures that preclude technological application.
What is the main challenge in developing molecule-based magnetic materials for technological applications?
data.answer: Most of these materials suffer from low operating temperatures

data.question: True or False: The postsynthetic chemical reduction of CrCl2(pyz)2 and Cr(OSO2CH3)2(pyz)2 leads to the same magnetic material.
What is the main difference between CrCl2(pyz)2 and Cr(OSO2CH3)2(pyz)2 in terms of their magnetic properties?
data.answer: CrCl2(pyz)2 features strong magnetic interactions leading to ferrimagnetic ordering below 55 K, while Cr(OSO2CH3)2(pyz)2 is an antiferromagnet below 10 K

data.question: True or False: The molecule-based magnets reported in this work have critical temperatures and coercivities that are inferior to those of traditional inorganic magnets.
What is the significance of the critical temperature of 515 K for molecule-based magnets?
data.answer: It exceeds the ordering temperature measured for V[TCNE]x by about 110 K, setting a new record for molecule-based magnets

data.question: True or False: The molecule-based magnets described in this work are electrically insulating.
What is the main synthetic approach used to prepare the high-temperature, lightweight magnets reported?
data.answer: Postsynthetic chemical reduction of preassembled coordination networks
